item.title: Wendy add a quote by Pamela Dean
item.description: "Look," said Janet, irritated, "if the thing you liked best to do in the world was read, and somebody offered to pay you room and board and give you a liberal arts degree if you would just read for four years, wouldn't you do it?" -- Pamela Dean

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Daphne du Maurier
item.description: "If only there could be an invention that bottled up a memory, like scent. And it never faded, and it never got stale. And then, when one wanted it, the bottle could be uncorked, and it would be like living the moment all over again." -- Daphne du Maurier

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Rob Thomas
item.description: "I swear, you are the only person I know who makes decisions based on what will provide the best material for a diary." -- Rob Thomas

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Ellen Potter
item.description: "Look, when do the really interesting things happen? Not when you've brushed your teeth and put on your pyjamas and are cozy in bed. They happen when you are cold and uncomfortable and hungry and don't have a roof over your head for the night." -- Ellen Potter

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Eva Ibbotson
item.description: "Dostoyevsky was her brother, Victorian children's books her passion and though she lived, when in funds, mainly on avocado pears, she took her bath each night with a different cookery book." -- Eva Ibbotson

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Mireya Mayor
item.description: "Every morning in the middle of nowhere, without electricity or anyone to impress, I'd take great care in picking out my outfit and hover in front of a business card-size mirror to apply my lip gloss and check my eyebrows. I also felt I had a strong case for bringing a little black dress on expeditions. Village parties spring up more often than you might expect, and despite never having been a Girl Scout, I like to be prepared." -- Mireya Mayor

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Kimberly Brubaker Bradley
item.description: "I kept traveling down the road. And everywhere it was the same. What was my name, who were my people? What was I supposed to say? That my father is the president, and my mother is his slave?" -- Kimberly Brubaker Bradley

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Lauren Oliver
item.description: "Once Mo had closed the gates, he returned to his little stone hut, and his half-eaten sandwich of butter and canned sardines, and his mug of thick hot chocolate, which every night he poured carefully into a thermos labeled COFFEE." -- Lauren Oliver

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Natalie Standiford
item.description: "You're a big sister?' I was shocked. She seemed so good-natured and compassionate." -- Natalie Standiford

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Lizzie K. Foley
item.description: "I'm afraid your literary prizes don't give you any jurisdiction in this particular instance, sir." -- Lizzie K. Foley

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Steve Sheinkin
item.description: "Here at great expense,' [Colonel Groves] moaned to Oppenheimer, 'the government has assembled the world's largest collection of crackpots." -- Steve Sheinkin

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Margo Lanagan
item.description: "Why must we climb away to the seal-less parts of the world?" -- Margo Lanagan

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Jeannie Mobley
item.description: "It won't be a chore, it will be a garden,' Holena said." -- Jeannie Mobley

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Kelly Barnhill
item.description: "But as she continued and finished her tale, I could tell that her heart was elsewhere, and when she excused herself to go to bed, she left without saying good night. After that, the princesses in her stories were always beautiful. Always." -- Kelly Barnhill

item.title: Wendy add a quote by Anna Rose Wright
item.description: "Let's put on our Thinking Caps and see if we can't have an idea,' said Cricket, passing the caps around." -- Anna Rose Wright
